history.text: Hey! Seen any new movies lately?

The Social Network came out in 2010 and was directed by David Fincher. It was adapted from a book called The Accidental Billionaires. It stars Jesse Eisenberg and Andrew Garfield. It's about the founding of Facebook. Have you seen it?
I haven't seen it, but I heard it was good.
Justin Timberlake was in it. So was the actor Armie Hammer.
That's kind of strange to see Justin Timberlake in movies, seeing that he's a singer. Was he any good?
He plays a character named Sean Parker who was kind of a jerk in the movie. You should see the film, it got great reviews. Critical response was very good.
I think I am definitely interested in watching it. Do you know it's rating or age restriction?
Unfortunately I do not know the rating/age restriction.
That's fine.
Would you say it's a serious or lighthearted movie? What genre would you classify it as?
It's in the biographical/drama genre. Do you like dramatic movies in general?
Just occasionally, because it can be pretty boring sometimes in my opinion. But I heard that this movie is not boring at all. Do you agree?

There are some interesting scenes in the movie. For example, Mark Zuckerberg is a student at Harvard and gets dumped by his girlfriend. He gets upset and
 then creates a website called Facemash by hacking into the "facebooks" of the various groups on campus and allows users of the site to rate which women are more attractive. This causes a lot of problems naturally and Zuckerberg gets academic probation, but the idea for Facebook springs out of that scene and sets the rest of the movie in motion.
Yeah that definitely sounds like a very interesting movie.
I will definitely see it as soon as possible
There was a little bit of controversy around the movie. The screenplay was based off of a book and some people believe that the author wasn't exactly truthful about everything.
That's crazy, but I believe it. I've heard about some craziness with the origin of facebook and stolen ideas, etc.
Do you think the movie was an accurate portrayel or do you think it was not truthful?

It's hard to say. Some critics said the author/screenplay writer took liberties with the biographical information but I don't know for sure, as I have not read the book. I would not be surprised if some details were changed for entertainment purposes.
I might decide to read the book first so I can make that judgement for myself.

Did you know that Facebook used to be called TheFacebook? Justin Timberlake's character Sean Parker (who was also the co-founder of Napster) told Zuckerberg to drop "the" and change it to just Facebook.
I think I've heard that. Facebook definitely has a better ring to it than "The Facebook".
Do you know any other interesting facts about this movie?
The actor Armie Hammer actually plays two characters in the movie, which are twins. He played both roles.

Oh wow, that's crazy. I thought it was real twins
 playing that from what I saw in a trailer.
Facebook also used to be limited to just a few Ivy League colleges. Funny now that it's open to everyone.

Well, I don't use Facebook that much anymore, but it's a good thing it became open to
 everyone or it would have never been the success it is today and there would be no movie about it. haha

There was a big lawsuit surrounding the creation of Facebook. The movie gets into it a bit. The twins claim that Zuckerberg stole their idea and so there's an aspect of the film that touches on all of the legal drama.
Right. That makes sense. So, it kind of just explains the whole madness of facebook from the very beginning
I have decided that I'm going to watch it this weekend.
Cool. I don't think you will regret it. The movie got a 96% score on Rotten Tomatoes. Do you pay attention to sites like that at all when you decide to watch a movie?
I actually don't. I tend to watch movies even with bad reviews or scores on rotten tomatoes, because I like to make up my own mind and sometimes people are too critical on movies.
Do you agree with the high score it got>
I think so. I enjoyed the movie quite a lot and have seen it maybe three or four times. I am big fan of the director in general.
Thanks for the convo, have a great day.

uid2response.feedback: This took way longer than 20 minutes, even though we had responded to each other more than 12 times.
